#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Communicate to Evoke Admiration
#Text=There are many areas to look at in communication : a message is communicated through visual , vocal and verbal means .
#Text=From that , comes the importance of body language , how we present ourselves , and so on .
#Text=The visual and vocal elements are indeed very important to effective communication , but we will not touch on that here .
#Text=Rather , let ’s look at why many people experience a challenge in communicating effectively from the verbal aspect :
#Text=Steps
#Text=Avoiding poor communication
#Text=Overcome common errors .
#Text=These are the some of the pitfalls to avoid and manage in order to evoke a response and admiration from listeners :
#Text=Self-consciousness .
#Text=To be a good conversationalist , be a great listener .
#Text=Be genuinely interested in what the other person has to say , ask the right questions ( because we genuinely want to know more ) and presto , people will laud you as great communicators !
#Text=It ’s often your own self-consciousness that makes you tongue-tied and awkward .
#Text=When you are so preoccupied with what intelligent idea to share next , you can barely concentrate on listening to and understanding the other party .
#Text=Non-empathy .
#Text=The other block to good communication is non-empathy .
#Text=If you are sometimes so intent on putting your ideas across , you may forget to be sensitive or empathic toward the other person .
#Text=Is the person in a rush , or does he or she have other matters on his or her mind ?
#Text=Lack of clarity .
#Text=This comes from a lack of clarity in your thoughts as well as your verbal communication .
#Text=It starts from your thoughts : are you quite clear in your mind as to what the message is that you wish to convey ?
#Text=From there , move on to effective choice of words .

#Text=Some people may have a language problem : they may be thinking in their mother language , say Mandarin or Punjabi , and trying to express their ideas in a language they are not comfortable with , say English .
#Text=Communicating with clarity
#Text=Learn to organize your thoughts .
#Text=Before making an important presentation , list down the points you want to make in a logical sense .
#Text=If language is a challenge , then write your ideas down in proper sentences and ask a friend to go through these for you .
#Text=That 's not to say you should read from your paper or memorize the “ speech ” but just writing it down and reading it a few times will help you a great deal in putting your message across .
#Text=Involve the listener in the conversation .
#Text=It should be about what he or she wants to listen rather than what you want to convey .
#Text=Many people think as long as they speak fluently , they are good communicators .
#Text=Not so , as those of you who have had to listen to someone go on and on about themselves , will testify .
#Text=They may be such eloquent speakers , and even entertaining at times , but there ’s only so much we can take in a one-way communication .
#Text=Some of you have probably been in a situation where you just wish you were somewhere else after 20 minutes !
#Text=Practice persuasive communication .
#Text=This takes place when the person we are communicating with , understands what we want to say , feels what we are feeling and is then motivated to take action on what we have said .
#Text=Ask questions .
#Text=One skill that can help you move from effective to persuasive communication is that of asking questions .

#Text=This is a powerful skill that once mastered , will indeed help you see immediate results in your daily communication – be it sales , presentation of ideas , talking to your friends or simply getting your child to do what you want .
#Text=Use compassionate communication .
#Text=Give your full attention to the person or persons you are with .
#Text=Listen carefully to what has been said .
#Text=Summarize back in your own terms .
#Text=Seek , most of all , to get to the heart of what the other person is saying and conveying ; things left unsaid are also part of the conversation .
#Text=What is the other person really trying to say ?
#Text=What perspective are they coming from , what about it makes you feel other or different , and how can you compassionately reconcile your two positions ?

#Text=Remember that everyone does it tough some of the time , and it may just be that you 're dealing with someone going through things that makes it hard for them to listen well but they will appreciate your ready understanding .
#Text=Tips
#Text=For effective communication to take place it is essential that the audience understands and accepts your expertise in the subjects you are dealing .
#Text=You should speak in short sentences with pause and punctuation at appropriate places .
#Text=This will help people to understand & absorb the gist of your message .
#Text=It helps always to get a good introduction to the audience before you speak .
#Text=The person introducing you should focus on the your area of expertise and achievement .
#Text=Your body language and speech should be in the same direction .
#Text=It should be complimentary and not obtrusive to each other .
#Text=It helps to spend few moments in familiarisation with the audience .
#Text=It helps to establish a wavelength with them .
#Text=You transmission and audience reception should be on the same wavelength , otherwise you cannot make an effective communication .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Please do not make statements you cannot substantiate .
#Text=Audience are intelligent , please do n't take them for granted .
#Text=If you do not have an answer to a question . please be honest and admit it .
#Text=Take their email or phone details and promise them to get back soon with your replies .
#Text=Please keep your promise .
